00029 #ifndef SC_PRIM_CHANNEL_H
00030 #define SC_PRIM_CHANNEL_H
00031 
00032 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_object.h"

00038 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 //  CLASS : sc_prim_channel
00040 //
00041 //  Abstract base class of all primitive channel classes.
00042 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 
00044 class SC_API sc_prim_channel
00045 : public sc_object
00046 {
00047     friend class sc_prim_channel_registry;
00048 
00049 public:
00050     enum { list_end = 0xdb };
00051 public:
00052     virtual const char* kind() const
00053         { return "sc_prim_channel"; }
00054 
00055     inline bool update_requested() 
00056         { return m_update_next_p != (sc_prim_channel*)list_end; }
00057 
00058     // request the update method to be executed during the update phase
00059     inline void request_update();
00060 
00061     // request the update method to be executed during the update phase
00062     // from a process external to the simulator.
00063     void async_request_update();
00064 
00065 protected:
00066 
00067     // constructors
00068     sc_prim_channel();
00069     explicit sc_prim_channel( const char* );
00070 
00071     // destructor
00072     virtual ~sc_prim_channel();
00073 
00074     // the update method (does nothing by default)
00075     virtual void update();
00076 
00077     // called by construction_done (does nothing by default)
00078     virtual void before_end_of_elaboration();
00079 
00080     // called by elaboration_done (does nothing by default)
00081     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00082 
00083     // called by start_simulation (does nothing by default)
00084     virtual void start_of_simulation();
00085 
00086     // called by simulation_done (does nothing by default)
00087     virtual void end_of_simulation();
00088 
00089     // indicate that this channel is async and could call async_request_update
00090     // therefore, the kernel should arrange to suspend rather than exit while
00091     // this channel is attached.
00092     bool async_attach_suspending();
00093     bool async_detach_suspending();
00094 
00095 protected:
00096 
00097     // to avoid calling sc_get_curr_simcontext()
00098 
00099     // static sensitivity for SC_THREADs and SC_CTHREADs
00100 
00101     void wait()
00102         { sc_core::wait( simcontext() ); }
00103 
00104 
00105     // dynamic sensitivity for SC_THREADs and SC_CTHREADs
00106 
00107     void wait( const sc_event& e )
00108         { sc_core::wait( e, simcontext() ); }
00109 
00110     void wait( const sc_event_or_list& el )
00111         { sc_core::wait( el, simcontext() ); }
00112 
00113     void wait( const sc_event_and_list& el )
00114         { sc_core::wait( el, simcontext() ); }
00115 
00116     void wait( const sc_time& t )
00117         { sc_core::wait( t, simcontext() ); }
00118 
00119     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu )
00120         { sc_core::wait( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), simcontext() ); }
00121 
00122     void wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event& e )
00123         { sc_core::wait( t, e, simcontext() ); }
00124 
00125     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event& e )
00126         { sc_core::wait( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), e, simcontext() ); }
00127 
00128     void wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00129         { sc_core::wait( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00130 
00131     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00132         { sc_core::wait( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00133 
00134     void wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00135         { sc_core::wait( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00136 
00137     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00138         { sc_core::wait( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00139 
00140     void wait( int n )
00141         { sc_core::wait( n, simcontext() ); }
00142 
00143 
00144     // static sensitivity for SC_METHODs
00145 
00146     void next_trigger()
00147         { sc_core::next_trigger( simcontext() ); }
00148 
00149 
00150     // dynamic sensitivity for SC_METHODs
00151 
00152     void next_trigger( const sc_event& e )
00153         { sc_core::next_trigger( e, simcontext() ); }
00154 
00155     void next_trigger( const sc_event_or_list& el )
00156         { sc_core::next_trigger( el, simcontext() ); }
00157 
00158     void next_trigger( const sc_event_and_list& el )
00159         { sc_core::next_trigger( el, simcontext() ); }
00160 
00161     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t )
00162         { sc_core::next_trigger( t, simcontext() ); }
00163 
00164     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu )
00165         {sc_core::next_trigger( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), simcontext() );}
00166 
00167     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event& e )
00168         { sc_core::next_trigger( t, e, simcontext() ); }
00169 
00170     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event& e )
00171         { sc_core::next_trigger( 
00172             sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), e, simcontext() ); }
00173 
00174     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00175         { sc_core::next_trigger( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00176 
00177     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00178         { sc_core::next_trigger( 
00179             sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00180 
00181     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00182         { sc_core::next_trigger( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00183 
00184     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00185         { sc_core::next_trigger( 
00186             sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00187 
00188 
00189     // for SC_METHODs and SC_THREADs and SC_CTHREADs
00190 
00191     bool timed_out()
00192         { return sc_core::timed_out( simcontext() ); }
00193 
00194 
00195 #if 0 // @@@@####
00196     // delta count maintenance
00197     sc_dt::uint64 delta_count()
00198         { return simcontext()->m_delta_count; }
00199 #endif
00200 
00201 private:
00202 
00203     // called during the update phase of a delta cycle (if requested)
00204     void perform_update();
00205 
00206     // called when construction is done
00207     void construction_done();
00208 
00209     // called when elaboration is done
00210     void elaboration_done();
00211 
00212     // called before simulation starts
00213     void start_simulation();
00214 
00215     // called after simulation ends
00216     void simulation_done();
00217 
00218     // disabled
00219     sc_prim_channel( const sc_prim_channel& );
00220     sc_prim_channel& operator = ( const sc_prim_channel& );
00221 
00222 private:
00223 
00224     sc_prim_channel_registry* m_registry;          // Update list manager.
00225     sc_prim_channel*          m_update_next_p;     // Next entry in update list.
00226 };
00227 
00228 
00229 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00230 //  CLASS : sc_prim_channel_registry
00231 //
00232 //  Registry for all primitive channels.
00233 //  FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY!
00234 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00235 
00236 class sc_prim_channel_registry
00237 {
00238     friend class sc_simcontext;
00239 
00240 public:
00241 
00242     void insert( sc_prim_channel& );
00243     void remove( sc_prim_channel& );
00244 
00245 
00246     int size() const
00247         { return static_cast<int>(m_prim_channel_vec.size()); }
00248 
00249     inline void request_update( sc_prim_channel& );
00250     void async_request_update( sc_prim_channel& );
00251 
00252     bool pending_updates() const
00253     { 
00254         return m_update_list_p != (sc_prim_channel*)sc_prim_channel::list_end 
00255                || pending_async_updates();
00256     }   
00257 
00258     bool pending_async_updates() const;
00259 
00260     // synchronization with attached async suspending channels
00261     //  - potentially blocks the current thread, if no explicitly
00262     //    attached async channels have posted updates, yet
00263     //  - returns true, if and only if there are NO pending synchronous
00264     //    updates after resuming from the external synchronization
00265     bool async_suspend();
00266 
00267     // (un)register a channel as being asynchronous
00268     //  - presence of asynchronous channels leads async_suspend() to
00269     //    block until any external async updates have been received
00270     //    (instead of exiting the simulation upon starvation)
00271     bool async_attach_suspending(sc_prim_channel&);
00272     bool async_detach_suspending(sc_prim_channel&);
00273 
00274 private:
00275 
00276     // constructor
00277     explicit sc_prim_channel_registry( sc_simcontext& simc_ );
00278 
00279     // destructor
00280     ~sc_prim_channel_registry();
00281 
00282     // called during the update phase of a delta cycle
00283     void perform_update();
00284 
00285     // called when construction is done
00286     bool construction_done();
00287 
00288     // called when elaboration is done
00289     void elaboration_done();
00290 
00291     // called before simulation starts
00292     void start_simulation();
00293 
00294     // called after simulation ends
00295     void simulation_done();
00296 
00297     // disabled
00298     sc_prim_channel_registry();
00299     sc_prim_channel_registry( const sc_prim_channel_registry& );
00300     sc_prim_channel_registry& operator = ( const sc_prim_channel_registry& );
00301 
00302 private:
00303     class async_update_list;   
00304 
00305     async_update_list*            m_async_update_list_p; // external updates.
00306     int                           m_construction_done;   // # of constructs.
00307     std::vector<sc_prim_channel*> m_prim_channel_vec;    // existing channels.
00308     sc_simcontext*                m_simc;                // simulator context.
00309     sc_prim_channel*              m_update_list_p;       // internal updates.
00310 };
00311

00313 // IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII
00314 
00315 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00316 //  CLASS : sc_prim_channel_registry
00317 //
00318 //  Registry for all primitive channels.
00319 //  FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY!
00320 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00321 
00322 inline
00323 void
00324 sc_prim_channel_registry::request_update( sc_prim_channel& prim_channel_ )
00325 {
00326     prim_channel_.m_update_next_p = m_update_list_p;
00327     m_update_list_p = &prim_channel_;
00328 }
00329 
00330 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00331 //  CLASS : sc_prim_channel
00332 //
00333 //  Abstract base class of all primitive channel classes.
00334 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00335 
00336 // request the update method (to be executed during the update phase)
00337 
00338 inline
00339 void
00340 sc_prim_channel::request_update()
00341 {
00342     if( ! m_update_next_p ) {
00343         m_registry->request_update( *this );
00344     }
00345 }
00346 
00347 // request the update method from external to the simulator (to be executed 
00348 // during the update phase)
00349 
00350 inline
00351 void
00352 sc_prim_channel::async_request_update()
00353 {
00354     m_registry->async_request_update(*this);
00355 }
00356 
00357 inline
00358 bool
00359 sc_prim_channel::async_attach_suspending()
00360 {
00361     return m_registry->async_attach_suspending(*this);
00362 }
00363 
00364 inline
00365 bool
00366 sc_prim_channel::async_detach_suspending()
00367 {
00368     return m_registry->async_detach_suspending(*this);
00369 }
00370 
00371 
00372 // called during the update phase of a delta cycle (if requested)
00373 
00374 inline
00375 void
00376 sc_prim_channel::perform_update()
00377 {
00378     update();
00379     m_update_next_p = 0;
00380 }
00381 
00382 
00383 } // namespace sc_core
